messages: 425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (01:48): Could someone please explain to me why TWO character streams are created when parsing isindex elements? http://www.whatwg.org/specs/web-apps/current-work/multipage/section-tree-construction.html#isindex
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:50): 425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72: copy-paste error on Hixie's part?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:50): or wait
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (01:51): not sure, because it explicitly says in the description of the streams "The two streams of character tokens together should..."
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:52): perhaps in some languages you would have the input in the middle or before?
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (01:54): hmm, yes, that's probably it
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (01:54): http://he.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=%D7%9E%D7%99%D7%95%D7%97%D7%93:Userlogin&returnto=1904
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:55): That text looks like it's still in front of the input box
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (01:55): (just with 'in front' being 'on the right')
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:55): indeed
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:56): RTL text still has the same source order
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (01:56): oh yeah, you're right
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:56): although the second stream of text might just be a POP BIDI character
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:57): "RTL OVERRIDE ...text...", <input>, "POP BIDI"
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (01:59): hmm, yeah, maybe
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (01:59): ask Hixie :)
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (02:00): yeah, i'll send him an email :p
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (02:00): or would it be better to email the mailinglist?
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:01): Seems slightly odd that <isindex prompt> isn't supported
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:01): (but I guess that's because nobody uses it in practice)
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (02:01): (but I'd have thought they would, otherwise they'd get totally inconsistent renderings)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:02): i guess we'll know when some browser vendor tries to implement this :)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:03): 425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72: you're implementing <isindex> in ph5p? :)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:03): cool
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (02:04): i'm working my way down in the tree construction process now
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:04): i checked it out the other day
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:04): seems you have made some progress
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:04): good work 8)
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (02:05): i hope it'll be good :p
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:07): i mentioned ph5p at my presentation
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (02:08): yeah, i noticed, thanks
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (02:08): i saw it on your slides i mean :p
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (02:09): are there a lot of implementations you know of? or just the 3 you listed on your presentation?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:11): http://waffle.wootest.net/2007/05/16/ruby-the-same-token/
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:11): not sure where he has the source of that
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:12): but those are the ones i know of
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (02:14): hmm, that's not a lot
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:16): would be cool to have it implemented in a browser, that would surely find bugs in the spec :)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:18): esp if it's used for quirks mode
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (02:19): but html5lib could be used to download a collection of pages to parse it, right?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:19): sure
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:20): or at least the parsing bit :)
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (02:20): or do you mean that you want to actually see how those websites are displayed?
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (02:20): yeah, for that it'll become a bit hard with just html5lib
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:21): i mean to have a downloadable build of firefox that has a real html5 parser, to see how many people compain about their sites broke in the new firefox
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:21): just using firefox as an example
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:22): for instance, we might find that the parsing spec actually has to take <script><!--</script>--></script> into account
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (02:23): yeah, having a Firefox build with an html5 parser would be awesome
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:23): or actually, firefox already doesn't do that for standards mode. let's see if there are any bug reports on that
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:29): hmm, the  <script><!--</script>--></script> might include some reparsing stories currently. what do you do with  <script><!--</script>x</script>EOF ?
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:29): (or just  <script><!--</script>x EOF)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:32): https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=311128

425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (02:33): hmm, i wish i couldn't test what ph5p does with that, but I've added 1000 lines of untested code today, so i need to get rid of all the syntax errors first :p
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:41): there are some dups of document.write('</script>'); not working in mozilla, even though it's only in standards mode
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (02:41): yup, it's annoying
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:42): that suggests to me that trying to remove support for pseudo-comments in quirks mode won't work
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (02:42): and we will have to spec it
425fb52813381a0bc3fce51541c8ca72 (02:42): yeah, i think you're right
